Fancyboxçš„è‡ªå®šä¹‰é€‰é¡¹åŒ…æ‹¬ï¼š

typeï¼šè®¾ç½®å¼¹å‡ºæ¡†çš„ç±»å‹ï¼Œå¯ä»¥æ˜¯â€™imageâ€™ã€â€˜iframeâ€™ã€â€™ajaxâ€™ç­‰

ajaxï¼šç”¨äºåŠ è½½åŠ¨æ€å†…å®¹ï¼Œæ¯”å¦‚é€šè¿‡ Ajax è¯·æ±‚ä»æœåŠ¡å™¨è·å–çš„ HTML å†…å®¹ã€‚

entry.title: iels writing
entry.content:
writing

Task 1

an introduction and two body paragraphs

ğŸ’¡ past tense

  • analyze the data and determine how to split the date into two(or three) logical parts.

  • writing the introduction, usually one sentence or two.

    • the chart(graph, diagram, table) demonstrates that
    • the first [ ] showsâ€¦..while the second showsâ€¦â€¦

    describe the form of the data, the title and the axis

  • writing the body

    • the opening sentence must describe the date that will be covered by the paragraph.

    • statements can be straight forward because the prompts provides information to support.

    • Highlight key points

      • different adjectives indicate how a point is important.
      distinctive notable
      main noticeable
      significant underlying

      one of the most significant change was

      another noticeable trend was

      there were only relatively small changes in

    • Diagram

      three paragraphs

      • first map (past or now) - From the first map,
        • There was a main road named running from the south to the north.
        • Grange Park was opened in 1920, a rectangular area with access from Arnold Avenue on the north.
      • second map (now or future) - the witnessed a huge alteration after the construction.
        • This area was empty before the rebuild, but now it has
        • the was modified to have a
      • summary - To sum up,
        • Despite the apparently significant changes, the park retains the basic elements of , with the addition of .

    • Flow chart

      ğŸ’¡ human agent - passive voice natural process - active voice
      ğŸ’¡ synonym: procedure step phase stage process

      • analyze the data and determine how to split the date into two(or three) logical parts.

      • first part

        • the whole process begins when
        • the next step is to

      • second part

        • afterwards
        • in the final stage of ,

      • In summary

        • there is a link between a and c
        • It is noteworthy that the first two stage (common point), while the third stage is ( uncommon point)

        use which when as v-ing and for removing repeat parts

    • line graph

      ğŸ’¡ past tense
      ğŸ’¡ the amount of the number of the proportion of the percentage of

      make sure use the right units of measurement

      before start writing, look carefully at how the axes of the graph are labeled.

      rose steadily peaked
      fell sharply fluctuated
      decreased gradually leveled off
      declined rapidly reached its lowest/ highest point
      increased moderately reach a peak
      plummeted slightly

      • introduction - the line graph demonstrates the keyword in place name between time and time : A, B and C. use : to introduce a list.

      • two body paragraphs

        • sentence patterns
          • verb + adverb: meat consumption dipped slightly\
          • there be + adjective + noun: there was a slight dip in meat consumption.
          • time frame + main clause + specific figures: From. to. meat consumption dipped slightly from 15 kgs to 12 kgs.

      • In summary

        if the visual prompt contains two or more graphs, your summary should indicate the connection between them.

        STATE the trends are broadly similar or different.

    • bar graph / pie chart

      ğŸ’¡ past tense

      describe and compare information

      nearly half a small minority
      three quarters just under a third
      the vast majority

      many much far significantly slightly nearly+ æ¯”è¾ƒçº§ + noun + than

      • intro - the bar chart gives information about
      • body paragraphs
        • (the same number) similar numbers of sth in A and in B
        • â€¦. in both A and B
        • as much (many) as B
        • whereas,
        • in contrast,
      • In summary the figure shows

    • two figures

      any obvious points, for example peaks and low points that help to illustrate the connection, should be highlighted.

      • intro

        • first sentence gives a description of what is shown in figure1.

        • second sentence gives a description of what is shown in figure2.

        • third sentence makes a statement about the relationship between 1 and 2.

          the line graph shows for sth at number-year intervals from time to time.

      • body paragraphs - analyze the data and determine how to split the date into two(or three) logical parts.

        • first body paragraphs - describe the overall relationship between a and b

        • second - describe the overall relationship between a and c

        • â€¦.

          the â€¦ peaked in time then fell sharply until time. After a slight recovery in time. it remained relatively flat thereafter.

          â€¦..showed a similar pattern with â€¦.

          â€¦.remained roughly constant. Not surprisingly, â€¦â€¦ also remained relatively steady throughout the period.

          when rose. , also appeared to â€¦â€¦

          the moreâ€¦â€¦, the moreâ€¦â€¦.

          â€¦..showed a similar pattern.

          whenâ€¦..falls, also.

          the lessâ€¦. the more

      • Overall

        • overall, the figures suggestâ€¦.. may be influenced by theâ€¦â€¦.
        • â€¦. appears to act as a stimulus toâ€¦.., whereas â€¦. may have the opposite effect.

    Task 2

    should focus on the underlying question. ideas presented must be logical.statements should be more moderate.

    these are extreme views and a good answer is likely to include the possibility that adjustments on both sides should occur.

    • analyzing the question

      circle a key word that you might want to repeat and underline any words or expressions which could be replaced with synonyms.

      • provide an explanation or prediction
      • evaluate an idea or belief evidence for / evidence against**
      • propose one or more solutions to a problem
      • evaluate the solution. what are possible solution?##

    • write a short plan

    • write a introduction

      • state the topic and suggest a reason why the topic is important

        • first sentence - background

        • second sentence - to state a common position or belief

          • still the vast majority of people opt for
          • others believe that
          • many people question whether â€¦â€¦

          reporting verb: believe argue suspect insist say support question

                             agree with  acknowledge to disagree with   doubt on

        • final sentence - a thesis statement

          • in fact, there are a number of reason for believing that. **
          • people are beginning to ask whether more can be done to reverse this trend. / to solve xxx problem.##
          • in this essay. will be discussed.

    • write the body

      • opening sentence - topic sentence

        each topic sentence usually advances the main idea. repeating a key word or phrase from the thesis statement makes the connection between each point and the main topic.

        • first
          • the first reason is. **
          • one possible approach is ##
        • second
          • â€¦â€¦ is another reason.**
          • an alternative approach would be to do sth.## ( suggest recommend advocate urge
          • one measure that. could take is toâ€¦â€¦

      • ideas sentences

        • evidence for/ evidence against**
        • positive consequences/ drawbacks
          • it would
          • Doing this could
          • â€¦..would probably have a
          • this could encourageâ€¦â€¦

      • example sentence

        • for example / for instance / such as
      ğŸ’¡ whereas, because, nevertheless, therefore, however, also, in contrast, as a consequence, since, as a result, due to (noun), because of (noun)
      ğŸ’¡ fortunately, importantly, inevitably, interestingly, obviously, surprisingly, unfortunately, somewhat

    • write the conclusion

      • in short, in summary, i would urge sb to do sth.

common expressions

advantage benefit positive consequence
disadvantage drawback negative consequence
opinion view point of view
however nevertheless
people individuals
problem dilemma difficulty
solution approach strategy
important significant noteworthy
issue topic concern
situation circumstance context phenomenon

entry.title: how to use proteinMPNN
entry.content:
è¦ä½¿ç”¨ProteinMPNNçš„æœ¬åœ°ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œå¿…é¡»ä»GitHubä¸‹è½½æºä»£ç ã€‚è¯¥ä»£ç ä¾èµ–äºå¤šä¸ªPythonåŒ…ï¼Œå› æ­¤è¿è¡Œå®ƒçš„æœ€ä¾¿æ·æ–¹å¼ä¹‹ä¸€æ˜¯é€šè¿‡åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªåŒ…å«å¿…è¦åŒ…çš„condaç¯å¢ƒã€‚å®‰è£…ProteinMPNNå’Œæ‰§è¡Œæœ¬æ•™ç¨‹æ‰€éœ€çš„åŒ…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡è¿è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹å‘½ä»¤æ¥å®Œæˆã€‚

è¿™äº›å‘½ä»¤æ¥æºäºmeilerè€å¸ˆçš„æ•™ç¨‹ï¼Œä»…ä¾›å‚è€ƒ[1] ã€‚

conda create â€“name ProteinMPNN_tutorial
conda activate ProteinMPNN_tutorial
conda install pytorch torchvision torchaudio cudatoolkit=11.3 -c pytorch
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
å¦‚æœå‡ºç°ï¼šERROR: Could not open requirements file: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: â€˜requirements.txtâ€™ éœ€è¦å…ˆåˆ›å»ºè¯¥æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œæ‰èƒ½è¿›è¡Œå®‰è£…ï¼Œæ­¥éª¤å¦‚ä¸‹ï¼š
1ï¼‰æ‰“å¼€cmdï¼Œè¿›å…¥åˆ°é¡¹ç›®æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ä¸‹
2ï¼‰æ‰§è¡Œè¯­å¥ï¼špip freeze > requirements.txt
3ï¼‰ä¹‹åæ‰§è¡Œï¼špip install requirements.txt
4ï¼‰é…ç½®å®Œæˆï¼Œæ‰“å¼€requirements.txtæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œå¯ä»¥çœ‹åˆ°ä¸€äº›é…ç½®ä¿¡æ¯ã€‚

  1. åŸºæœ¬ç”¨æ³•

1.1 æ¿€æ´»åŒ…å«è¿è¡ŒProteinMPNNæ‰€éœ€åŒ…çš„condaç¯å¢ƒã€‚

conda activate ProteinMPNN_tutorial
1.2 è¿è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹å‘½ä»¤æ˜¾ç¤ºä¸»ProteinMPNNåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºçš„å¸®åŠ©ä¿¡æ¯ã€‚

cd ProteinMPNN #cdåˆ°ä¸‹è½½äº†codeçš„æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹
python protein_mpnn_run.py -h
è¯¥å‘½ä»¤å°†æ˜¾ç¤ºè„šæœ¬ä½¿ç”¨è¯´æ˜å’Œå¯ç”¨çš„è¾“å…¥å‚æ•°ã€‚è¯¥è„šæœ¬æ˜¯åˆå§‹åŒ–å’Œè¿è¡Œæ¨¡å‹çš„å”¯ä¸€è„šæœ¬ã€‚å…¶ä»–å¯ç”¨çš„å‡½æ•°ç”¨äºå‡†å¤‡è¾“å…¥æ•°æ®å’Œåˆ›å»ºé€‰é¡¹æ–‡ä»¶ã€‚

1.3 é¦–å…ˆï¼Œåœ¨æ²¡æœ‰é™„åŠ é€‰é¡¹çš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹å¯¹1QYSçš„æ•´ä¸ªåºåˆ—è¿›è¡Œç®€å•çš„é‡æ–°è®¾è®¡ã€‚åˆ‡æ¢åˆ°æ•™ç¨‹ç›®å½•å¹¶åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ–°ç›®å½•ä»¥é‡æ–°è®¾è®¡1QYSåºåˆ—ã€‚

å‚æ•°å«ä¹‰
â€“pdb_path è¾“å…¥pdbæ–‡ä»¶çš„å…¨è·¯å¾„ï¼›
â€“pdb_path_chains éœ€è¦è®¾è®¡pdbæ–‡ä»¶ä¸­çš„å“ªä¸€æ¡é“¾ï¼›
â€“out_folder æ–‡ä»¶è¾“å‡ºè·¯å¾„ï¼›
â€“num_seq_per_target è®¾è®¡çš„è›‹ç™½åºåˆ—è¾“å‡ºæ¡æ•°ï¼›
â€“sampling_temp é‡‡æ ·æ¸©åº¦ï¼Œå»ºè®®å¯å–å€¼0.1ï¼Œ 0.15ï¼Œ 0.2ï¼Œ 0.25ï¼Œ 0.3ï¼›
â€“seed è®¾ç½®éšæœºæ•°

python protein_mpnn_run.py â€“pdb_path input/1qys/1qys.pdb
â€“out_folder ./1qys_designs/ â€“num_seq_per_target 10 â€“sampling_temp â€œ0.1â€
â€“seed 0 â€“batch_size 1 â€“model_name v_48_020
åºåˆ—ç”Ÿæˆåº”è¯¥åªéœ€å‡ ç§’é’Ÿã€‚ç”Ÿæˆçš„è¾“å‡ºåºåˆ—å¯ä»¥åœ¨./1qys_designs/seqsä¸­æ‰¾åˆ°ã€‚

å¯èƒ½ä¼šå‡ºç°ModuleNotFoundError: No module named â€˜numpyâ€˜

ä¸­é—´åŠ äº†ä¸€ä¸ªé•œåƒï¼Œè¿™æ ·ä¸‹è½½æ›´å¿«ï¼Œnumpyè¿™ä¸ªåº“ä¸‹å¾—æ¯”è¾ƒæ…¢å®¹æ˜“è¶…æ—¶ï¼Œç”¨é•œåƒä¸‹æ›´æ–¹ä¾¿ä¸€ç‚¹ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥ç”¨ä»¥ä¸‹çš„æ™®é€šä¸‹è½½ï¼š

pip install numpy
ä¸‹è½½å®Œä¹‹åï¼Œç”¨pip listæŸ¥çœ‹æ˜¯å¦ä¸‹è½½æˆåŠŸï¼Œå‡ºç°numpyå°±æ˜¯æˆåŠŸäº†ã€‚

1.4 æŸ¥çœ‹ç”Ÿæˆçš„åºåˆ—æ–‡ä»¶ã€‚

gedit ./1qys_designs/seqs/1qys.fa
1qys.faåŒ…å«åŸå§‹åºåˆ—ä»¥åŠfastaæ ¼å¼ä¸­çš„æ‰€æœ‰è®¾è®¡ã€‚æ¯ä¸ªåºåˆ—éƒ½é™„å¸¦ä¸€ä¸ªåˆ†æ•°å’Œä¸€ä¸ªåºåˆ—æ¢å¤å€¼ã€‚åœ¨è¿™ç§æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œåˆ†æ•°å’Œå…¨å±€åˆ†æ•°åº”è¯¥æ˜¯ç›¸åŒçš„ã€‚å…¨å±€åˆ†æ•°å¯¹åºåˆ—ä¸­çš„æ‰€æœ‰æ®‹åŸºè¿›è¡Œå¹³å‡ï¼Œè€Œåˆ†æ•°ä»…ä»£è¡¨è®¾è®¡æ®‹åŸºçš„å¹³å‡å€¼ã€‚åºåˆ—æ¢å¤æ˜¾ç¤ºè®¾è®¡æ®‹åŸºçš„ç™¾åˆ†æ¯”èº«ä»½ã€‚

  1. æ®‹åŸºåå‘

é€šè¿‡åœ¨æœ¬åœ°å®‰è£…ProteinMPNNï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨GitHubå­˜å‚¨åº“ä¸­å‘å¸ƒçš„ä¸€äº›åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºä¹‹ä¸€ã€‚åœ¨ProteinMPNN/helper_scripts/ä¸­å¯ä»¥æ‰¾åˆ°ç”¨äºç”Ÿæˆè¾“å…¥æ–‡ä»¶ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ProteinMPNNçš„ä¸€äº›ä¸“ç”¨é€‰é¡¹çš„è„šæœ¬ï¼ˆæ®‹åŸºåå·®ï¼Œçœç•¥æ°¨åŸºé…¸ï¼Œå›ºå®šä½ç½®ï¼‰ã€‚å…¶ä¸­ä¸€ä¸ªåº”ç”¨æ˜¯å¼•å…¥æ®‹åŸºåå‘ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ä½¿ç–æ°´æ®‹åŸºæ›´æœ‰å¯èƒ½è€ŒåŠèƒ±æ°¨é…¸æ›´ä¸å¯èƒ½ã€‚

2.1 ä½¿ç”¨ä»¥ä¸‹å‘½ä»¤ä½¿ç”¨æ®‹åŸºåå‘é‡æ–°è®¾è®¡1qysåºåˆ—ã€‚

mkdir 1qys_designs_biased

â€“AA_list â€œA F G I L M P V W Y Câ€
â€“bias_list â€œ1.39 1.39 1.39 1.39 1.39 1.39 1.39 1.39 1.39 1.39 -1.1â€

â€“out_folder ./1qys_designs_biased/ â€“num_seq_per_target 10 â€“sampling_temp â€œ0.1â€
â€“seed 0 â€“batch_size 1 â€“model_name v_48_020
â€“bias_AA_jsonl 1qys_bias.jsonl
2.2 é€šè¿‡ä¸ºä¸¤ç§è®¾è®¡åˆ›å»ºåºåˆ—æ ‡å¿—ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥å¯è§†åŒ–æ°¨åŸºé…¸åå·®æ˜¯å¦å¯¹è®¾è®¡åºåˆ—äº§ç”Ÿäº†å½±å“ã€‚

python scripts/create_logo.py â€“fasta 1qys_designs/seqs/1qys.fa â€“output 1qys_unbiased_logo.png

æŸ¥çœ‹ä¸¤ä¸ªåˆ›å»ºçš„åºåˆ—æ ‡å¿—ã€‚æ‚¨å°†çœ‹åˆ°åå‘æŸäº›æ®‹åŸºä¼šå¸¦æ¥é£é™©ï¼Œè€Œä¸”åå‘çš„ç±»å‹å’Œå¼ºåº¦åº”è¯¥ç»è¿‡æ·±æ€ç†Ÿè™‘ã€‚

  1. å›ºå®šä½ç½®

æƒ³è¦é‡æ–°è®¾è®¡SARS-CoV-2åˆºçªè›‹ç™½å—ä½“ç»“åˆç»“æ„åŸŸå’Œè¿·ä½ è›‹ç™½æŠ‘åˆ¶å‰‚LCB3ä¹‹é—´çš„ç•Œé¢ã€‚è¯¥å¤åˆç‰©çš„ç»“æ„åœ¨7JZMä¸‹è¢«ç»“æ™¶å¹¶å‘è¡¨ï¼Œå¯ä»¥åœ¨inputs/7JZM/7jzm.pdbä¸­æ‰¾åˆ°ã€‚

3.1 åªè®¾è®¡LCB3ï¼ˆé“¾Aï¼‰çš„æ®‹åŸºã€‚ä¸ºæ­¤ï¼Œé¦–å…ˆä¸ºåŒ…å«è¦é‡æ–°è®¾è®¡ä½ç½®çš„é“¾åˆ†é…é“¾ã€‚

â€“output_path 7jzm.jsonl

â€“output_path 7jzm_assigned.jsonl â€“chain_list â€œAâ€
parse_multiple_chains.pyä»¥ç›®å½•ä¸ºè¾“å…¥å˜é‡ï¼Œè¿˜å¯ç”¨äºä¸€æ¬¡è§£æå’Œéšåè®¾è®¡ç›®å½•ä¸­å¤šä¸ªpdbæ–‡ä»¶ã€‚

3.2 ç²—ç•¥å‡è®¾LCB3çš„ç•Œé¢æ®‹åŸºåŒ…æ‹¬ä¸åˆºçªè›‹ç™½çš„è·ç¦»ä¸º5åŸƒçš„æ‰€æœ‰æ®‹åŸºã€‚ä½¿ç”¨pymolæ£€æŸ¥è›‹ç™½è´¨ç»“æ„å¹¶é€‰æ‹©è¦è¿›è¡Œè®¾è®¡çš„æ®‹åŸºæ˜¯ä¸€ç§æ–¹å¼ã€‚åœ¨è¿™ç§æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œåœ¨pymolä¸­åŠ è½½ç»“æ„ï¼š

pymol input/7jzm/7jzm.pdb
é€‰æ‹©å¹¶è¾“å‡ºLCB3ç•Œé¢çš„æ®‹åŸºã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬åœ¨pymolå‘½ä»¤è¡Œä¸­è¾“å…¥ä»¥ä¸‹å†…å®¹ï¼š

select interface, br. chain A within 5 of chain B
reslist =[]
iterate interface and name CA, reslist.append((resi))
print(*reslist)
3.3 æ‚¨ç°åœ¨æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªä½ç½®åˆ—è¡¨ï¼Œå¯ä»¥å°†å…¶è®¾ç½®ä¸ºå¯è®¾è®¡ã€‚ProteinMPNNåªèƒ½æ¥å—åº”è¯¥å›ºå®šçš„ä½ç½®å­—å…¸ã€‚ä½¿ç”¨ä»¥ä¸‹pythonè„šæœ¬åˆ›å»ºåŒ…å«å›ºå®šä½ç½®çš„jsonlæ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œä»¥å­—å…¸æ ¼å¼ã€‚

python ~/ProteinMPNN/helper_scripts/make_fixed_positions_dict.py â€“specify_non_fixed

3.4 ç°åœ¨æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨é€‰å®šçš„æ®‹åŸºè¿è¡ŒProteinMPNNã€‚æ­¤å¤–ï¼Œè¿™æ¬¡æˆ‘ä»¬æƒ³è¾“å‡ºæ¯ä¸ªæ®‹åŸºçš„å¾—åˆ†ï¼Œä»¥äº†è§£å“ªäº›ç‚¹çªå˜å¯¹åºåˆ—å¾—åˆ†è´¡çŒ®æœ€å¤§ã€‚
